intro: Erophila subtilis, commonly known as the slender erophila, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Australia. It belongs to the family Poaceae, commonly known as the grass family. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in panicles. It thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas or near freshwater sources. Due to its adaptability, it is sometimes considered an invasive species in certain regions.
